message:
With the completion of an astounding year of the society and a memorable tenure of GYWS members, we heartily announce the new positions of GYWS members: 

Vice President: Prerit Jain
General Secretary: Het Shah
UG Coordinators: Anshika Shristi, Shivam Pandey
PG Coordinators: Hemant Nagar, Vinay Arya
RS coordinator: Abhishek
LIGHT Coordinator: Sumit Sen 

Gopali Youth Welfare Society wishes them all the best for their future endeavours. We hope you take this society to the greater heights.

Benjamin Franklin has rightly said, 'By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.'
On this line of thought, Gopali Youth Welfare Society, in association with Student Welfare Group - SWG, IIT Kharagpur, is working towards building a valuable database of potential blood donors in our campus. 
Every noble soul is requested come forward and register for the same. Let us all be prepared, as emergencies may arise any time.

story: Gopali Youth Welfare Society shared Prayas - An initiative of GYWS's post.
message: Gopali Youth Welfare Society shared Prayas - An initiative of GYWS's post. GYWS will be organising " *Rural Innovation Program" to be held from 5th - 10th March* - five day program in association with the MHRD Institution Innovation Council - IIT Delhi & Gopali Youth Welfare Society. The objective of the program as jointly realized by both the organizations is to provide ground level exposure to the students of some of the nation’s best universities regarding the socio-economic problems of rural India by providing them an opportunity of real-life one to one interaction with the rural people. The programme will not only ensure the student’s exposure to the grass-root realities of rural India but will also make sure that the students identify and solve some real-life problems through innovation and technology. IIC-IIT Delhi last program featured in a news channel.

story: Gopali Youth Welfare Society shared LIGHT - Bhopal's post.
message: Gopali Youth Welfare Society shared LIGHT - Bhopal's post. We all have special talent within us but due to unavailability of opportunities we ain't able to express it to the world.So here is something where LiGHT-BHOPAL under its initiatives of [Youth Upliftment,Women Empowerment,Social Awareness] conducted an OPEN MIC event named KHULE AAM BOL where people with different talent comes and performed on stage.We the LiGHT team- Thanks every performer and audience for coming and making this event a grand success. #GYWS #LIGHT #OPENMIC #LIGHTBHOPAL

Children are indeed the special creation of God .

story: Gopali Youth Welfare Society added 7 new photos.
message:
If you want happiness for an hour, take a nap. If you want happiness for a day, go fishing. If you want happiness for a year, inherit a fortune. If you want happiness for a lifetime, help somebody. Happiness is found in helping others. 
 Many people out there need some help, one or the other way. They might not find a platform  that can help them to make a living , or learn something that will be beneficial and can change their life. In order to reach such people and provide help from our NGO ,We conducted a press conference on 10th November in GYWS office under the presence of our president This conference was to increase our reach to the greater portion of the society so that many people can get our help and can also directly help us in our initiative to make our country better.
All the media houses were happy to know that students of IIT Kharagpur have started a big initiative towards the society .
#gyws #press_conference #Light 
#youth_welfare #helpinghands

story: Gopali Youth Welfare Society added 7 new photos.
message:
We conducted a press conference today morning in our office. Mr Mrinal Bhanja, the founder and president of this NGO , was also present to make this conference more memorable. This conference was to spread awareness to the people regarding our work so that children from the under-privileged section can get the quality education and also youth can get the coaching and get themselves employed. 
All the media houses were happy to know that students of IIT Kharagpur have started a big initiative towards the society to make our country better.
#gyws #press_conference #Light 
#youth_welfare

story: Gopali Youth Welfare Society shared LIGHT-Samvedana's post.
message: Gopali Youth Welfare Society shared LIGHT-Samvedana's post. Thousands of patients need blood transfusion. Just three teaspoon of blood can save the life of a premature baby. Every drop counts, one single donation can be split into three separate parts. Doing our little bit for society with the motto `DONATE BLOOD, DONATE LIFE `the Government college of engineering aurangabad recently organised Blood donation camp where more than 151 donors donated blood.

Knowledge is a wealth that grows on sharing, also its the best gift you can give to anyone. Knowledge helps a person grow, become self independent and explore oneself. 

This weekend, we take the pleasure to invite you all to join us and celebrate the joy of giving week. We invite each and everyone interested to come up and teach dance, music, or any other art form and conduct educational activities for the students of Jagriti Vidya Mandir. 

Venue - Jagriti Vidya Mandir 
Date - 6th October, saturday. 
Time - 8-11 a.m.

Everyone interested Kindly fill up the google form so that we can make travel arrangements. 

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSckGDZ0UcijLaG5QXG2s5w2x9JgDsTltS4dwvttNzOzYlYfvw/viewform

Contact : Prerit Jain - 7477858578

story: Gopali Youth Welfare Society added 5 new photos.
message:
“Each day we live into the future. It is not just our past that shapes us. The future that one lives into shapes one's being and action in the Present.”
Gopali Youth Welfare Society celebrated its foundation day 2018 on 25th August in “Jagriti Vidya Mandir ” with the children of JVM. The Programme had the Tree plantation drive, followed by competitions like Drawing, Crafts-making , Rakhi-making  to enhance the creativity of the children.
The achievements of an organization are the results of the combined efforts of every individual.

story: Gopali Youth Welfare Society added 5 new photos.
message:
“Yoga is the artwork of Awareness on the canvas of Body, mind and soul.”
    On the occasion of 4th International Yoga Day, Gopali Youth Welfare Society in collaboration with Nehru Yuva Kendra, Paschim Midnapore Organized a Yoga Programme at Ramchandra Mission in Village Gopali on 21st June 2018.
     Then, Dist.Youth convention with the theme of  “Youth for Nation Building” discussed their view about Youth, specially Youth of Paschim Midnapore district and their scope in nation Building Activities.
   The Programme was to bring Awareness about the Yoga and its benefits in day-to-day life.

story: Gopali Youth Welfare Society added 2 new photos.
message:
The JNAN GHOSH STADIUM and TATA STEEL COMPLEX, these two are the places where multiple sports activities are carried out, ranging from football, basketball and hockey. 

#fact - Jnan Ghosh stadium is named after the first director of our institute - Sir J. C. Ghosh.

As the academic year just got off to a start, it's time you buckle up to explore the various chances you have to serve the society.

Gopali Youth Welfare society is organising selections for the posts of Senior Executive Members for undergraduate sophomores (UG 2nd years) into various teams.
So, take your time out to learn about us as you gear up to come to our interview.

See you at Gymkhana on 23rd July 2018 from 7:30 pm onwards.

Interested students may please fill the form below:
https://goo.gl/forms/0of9brCfg21R304k2

Ramzan Id or Id Ul Fitr is one of the most important festivals for Muslim. This festival marks the end of the holy month Ramzan. On this day Muslims wear new clothes, offer Namaz, prepare traditional food items and meet and greet friends. Read on to know more about the significance and celebration of Ramzan Id.

story: Gopali Youth Welfare Society added a new photo — with Ayush Banerjee.
message: Our mission to serve the people of Gopali has always been well supported and driven by the contributions and inspiration from the IIT Kharagpur fraternity. Every year, we have a lot of seniors passing out after a successful stay in the campus and we at Gopali Youth Welfare Society have always left an important impression on each and every student of the eminent institution. This is what one of the most eminent students of the 2018 pass out batch, Mr. Ayush Banerjee has to say about us.

message:
Here’s a chance to gift someone in need as you leave KGP!
GYWS invites all passing-out students to donate their used and still functioning (or even those that need minor repair) bicycles to us! These bicycles shall be provided to the children who passed out from Jagriti Vidya Mandir and study in class VI at Hijli High School under the aegis of our support. 
So, interested students please convey your interest of being a part of this noble cause by filling in this form:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfYnLeq4rLIzBMkqtijQ-Kq9mSoUueDd6ANZN3uNTkfvdLctg/viewform

Pedals for progress : "DONATE YOUR CYCLES TO THE NEEDY." 

This is an annual drive conducted by the Gopali Youth Welfare Society, wherein we collect cycles from our fellow mates, who are to bade farewell to the KGP campus this term. These cycles are then repaired and redistributed to the people and the children in the villages nearby free of cost. 

Come let us all be a part of this noble cause, and do our little part for the society. 

Contact information : 
Prerit : 7477858578 
Vijay : 9494312725

Interested members kindly fill in the form :

The final semester of a student is always filled with nostalgia,excitement and more importantly love. As every memory made here  somehow gets etched in one's heart.
We present a series of blogs of final year students who have worked so far with us.
Thanks Jay Prakash for being a part of our family! :)

Computer Training is one of our initiatives that has improved the lives of locals in a significant manner. Here, we show an interview with one such woman who shares her experience.

"There are two powers in the world; one is the sword and the other is the pen. There is a great competition and rivalry between the two. There is a third power stronger than both, that of the women."
-Muhammad Ali Jinnah
Woman, you are at the leader. Cheers to the strength of womanhood!
Happy Womens' Day!

story: Gopali Youth Welfare Society shared TISS Aesdii's post.
message: Gopali Youth Welfare Society shared TISS Aesdii's post. Gopali Youth Welfare Society believes India’s progress depends on the progress of its weakest links. An esteemed empanelled partner of #TISS AESDII, it continues to bridge the development gap by making quality education accessible to children and youth in #Gopali village, #WestBengal. Their 'Nukkad Natak' (street play) against child sexual abuse performed with the support of students from IIT-Kharagpur during Republic Day celebrations 2018 received extensive media accolades https://m.jagran.com/west-bengal/khadagpur-break-the-silence-save-childhood-17425825.html. Learn more about Gopali Youth Welfare Society www.gyws.org #EndChildSexualAbuse

As Yogdaan, the annual donation drive of Gopali Youth Welfare Society ends in two days, all those willing to contribute can fill up the Google form in case your room has not been covered.

You can also donate us through online transfer. The account details are available on our website. Send us a mail mentioning transaction details, your name, hall, room number and contact number and our members will contact you and give you the receipt.

Contact:
Prerit Jain (preritjain1234@gmail.com)
Prashanthi Silla (prashanthi.silla@gmail.com )

story: Gopali Youth Welfare Society shared LIGHT's post.
message: Gopali Youth Welfare Society shared LIGHT's post. LIGHT takes pleasure to announce the list of colleges where our centers are about to be opened by New Year 2018. The institutes are as follows: 1. NIT Warangal 2. National Institute of Technology Calicut 3. Sagar Group of Institutions (SISTec), Bhopal We are very glad to welcome these prestigious institutions into the LIGHT family! There are a lot of other IITs, NITs and IIITs in the final step of agreement and we look forward to help any college that has an intention to be a part of this noble mission.

story: Gopali Youth Welfare Society added 4 new photos.
message:
On the occasion of Sports Day, the team of Gopali Youth Welfare Society along with teachers of Jagriti Vidya Mandir conducted different sports events in school in order to promote the importance of sports in Education and Fitness. The events definitely helped in the overall development of the students in an enthusiastic and entertaining manner. 
#gyws #jvm #education #sports #fitness
